comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Wonderful document. It almost seems that driving on the left was law (rather than a 'recommendation') in Australia (1820) BEFORE England (1835). See - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Right-_and_left-hand_traffic#History . Ten shillings was a huge fine in 1820 - about Aus$800 by average earnings nowadays. See www.measuringworth.com/ukcompare/ . YAY FOR MACQUARIE !
